wikipedia_page.main: Edward G. Burton (1869 – after 1891) was an English professional footballer who played in the Football Alliance for Small Heath. Born in the Acocks Green district of Birmingham, he played for Highfield Villa before joining Small Heath. A centre forward, he played only once for the club, deputising for the injured Harry Morris, and soon returned to local football. Burton died in Birmingham.

response: *Edward Burton (theologian) (1794–1836), English theologian, Regius Professor of Divinity at Oxford
*Edward Burton (zoologist) (1790–1867), British Army surgeon and zoologist
*Edward Burton (MP), Member of Parliament  for Pembroke
*Edward Burton Gleeson (1803–1870), South Australian settler, farmer and founder of the town of Clare
